intro: Ficalhoa laurifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf ficalhoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, waxy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
